p: For both species, the uptake rates were highest when grown at 20 °C with those for the fast-growing B. hordeaceus being twice as high as those for the slow-growing B. erectus (Fig. 2a). Both chilling and warming reduced these rates, with NP max close to zero at 7 °C for both species but a smaller decline at 30 °C. Under LA conditions the response pattern for both species remained similar to that under FA conditions (Fig. 2a) but rates at 20 °C and 30 °C were lower than under FA.
